request.description:
this route doesn't work properly at this time:
1. in order to use templates, an 'index.html' cannot exist in the static asset directory
2. if templates isn't used, another method must be devised on how to pass frontend/backend shared constants
3. if only static assets are to be served, maybe consider to serve directly from nginx

needs to settle how the frontend will generate
1. index.html,
2. app.js(app.min.js),
3. app.css(app.min.css),
4. and the other css libs to be included(whether to use cdn or copy from local, bulma/font-awesome)

1. request
	  * header:
	    1. Content-Type:
		      * application/json
		      * multipart/form-data
		      * x-www-form-urlencoded
	  * body:
	    1. email*
	    2. password*
2. response
	  * header: {"Content-Type":"application/json"}
	  * body:
	    1. data: a jwt string containing the following in the payload:
		      * id: uuidV4
		      * name: string
		      * email: email string
		      * admin: boolean (indicate if the account has admin privilege or not)
3. notes:
	  * request by account with NULL password field will fail
	  * token is valid for 24 hours

hit this endpoint to create:

1. user without login privilege (requires admin jwt)
2. user with login privilege (admin account requires admin jwt)
3. regular user and company information
4. user + company info + order info

use the content body to control what's created

1. request:
  * headers:
    - Content-Type:
      1. application/json
      2. x-www-form-urlencoded
      3. multipart/form-data
    - x-access-token: jwt string (optional, but must be present and with admin privilege when attempting to register an admin contact)
  * params: n/a
  * queries: n/a
  * body:
    1. botPrevention*
    2. company (when empty, contact name will be filled in instead)
    3. name*
    4. email* (unique)
    5. password (optional, but account will not have login priv)
    6. countryId
    7. address
    8. telephone
    9. fax
    10. website
    11. mobile
    12. admin
    13. productIdList[] (optional)
    14. quantities[] (optional, length should be the same as productIdList)
2. response:
  * headers: {"Content-Type":"application/json"}
  * body:
    1. data: jwt string upon success
3. notes:
  * upon success, a 24 hours token will be issued with the following properties in the payload:
    1. id
    2. name
    3. email
    4. admin
  * email will be validated at insertion
  * contacts with NULL password field is only used for contact display, will not be able to login

request.description:
get a contact information by id

1. request:
	* headers: {"x-access-token":jwt}
	* params: :contactId: uuidV4
2. response:
	* headers: {"Content-Type":"application/json"}
	* body: 'data' property: detailed user data without credential information
3. notes:
	* access is only granted when the following conditions are met:
		1. jwt is issued by server
		2. admin and staff has full access
		3. jwt payload carries an contact id that matches :contactId
	* server only returns one record related to :contactId

request.description:
update a contact record according to the access privilege

1. request:
	* headers:
		1. Content-Type:
			* application/x-www-form-urlencoded
			* application/json
			* multipart/form-data
		2. x-access-token: jwt
	* params: :contactId - target contact record id
	* body: all are optional, but some props can only be updated with proper privilege
		1. email
		2. name
		3. mobile
		4. password (admin and user only)
		5. companyId (admin only)
		6. admin (admin only)
2. response:
	* headers: {"Content-Type":"application/json"}
	* body: 'data' property contains the edited content record with company details
3. notes:

1. request:
	* headers:
		1. x-access-token: jwt token
		2. Content-Type: multipart/form-data
	* body: {"photos":[uploaded photo list]}
2. response: on success, data property contains a list of photoId's
3. notes:
	* physical photos are removed from server after request is completed
	* file types are limited to: .jpg .jpeg .png .gif .svg .bmp
	* file size are limited to 500kb each
	* uploaded photos are not associated with any product or series, and active field is false

	* query url: both can exist at the same time, but at least one must be present

item.name: get product list with optional details and pagination

request.description:
1. request:
	* headers: n/a
	* url query:
		1. per_page=integer - specify how many records per page (automatically limited to between 1 and record count)
		2. page=integer - specify the page
		3. details - gives optional 'tags' and 'photos' properties in the data body
		4. inactive - allow searching for inactive (active=false) products
	* body: n/a
2. response: see example
	* headers:
		1. Content-Type: application/json,
		2. Link: pagination string to be parsed with parse-link-header
	* body:
		1. data: contains a list of products (with optional details, tags, photos)
		2. pagination: pagination related information
3. notes:
	* per_page and page must both be present in order to trigger pagination functionality
	* by default, only active records are retrieved

request.description:
performs case-insensitive comparison of a string against:
	1. product code
	2. product name
	3. product specification
	4. product description
	5. series name of the associated series to products
	6. tag name of the associated tags to products
to get a list of products and associated details

1. request:
	* headers: n/a
	* params: n/a
	* queries: ?wildCard=string to be searched
	* body: n/a
2. response:
	* headers: {"Content-Type":"application/json"}
	* body:
		- data: array of product records with details
			1. series: associated series object
			2. tags: array of tag objects
			3. photos: array of photo objects (without actual photo data)
3. notes: n/a

response.name: search product listings

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: ETag
header.description: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest

header.name: X-Powered-By
header.description: Specifies the technology (ASP.NET, PHP, JBoss, e.g.) supporting the web application (version details are often in X-Runtime, X-Version, or X-AspNet-Version)

request.description:

4. notes:
  * series name is not uniqu, so a tree node may have multiple duplicating series of the same name
  * new series is always placed at the end of displaySequence
  * displaySequence is automatically determined

query.description: move to a different series node

request.description:
1. request
	* headers: {"x-access-token":"jwt string"}
	* parameters: seriesId: uuidV4
	* queries:
		1. name - string
		2. active - boolean
		3. displaySequence - integer
			* min: 0, max: sibling count - 1, will be limited to this range automatically without error
		4. parentSeriesId - uuidV4
			* provide no value to move series to root, e.g. "?parentSeriesId"
	* body: n/a
	* notes: at least one of the query must be present and only **ONE** query will be processed per request (in the listed precedence)
2. response
	* headers: {"Content-Type":"application/json"}
	* body:
		1. data: a json representation of the updated product record (no details)
3. notes:
	* patching 'parentSeriesId' always puts it at the end of the existing displaySequence order
	* menuLevel value cannot be updated directly, will be determined automatically

1. request
	* headers: {"x-access-token":"jwt token"}
	* parameters: seriesId
	* body: n/a
2. response:
	* headers: {"Content-Type":"application/json"}
	* body:
		1. data: integer representing the number of records deleted (should always be 1 on success)
3. notes:
	* server will return error if the target record has childSeries (other series with the target's id as parentSeriesId)
	* associated photos and products will have 'seriesId' field removed
	* for associated photos that are **not** associated with any products:
		1. seriesId = NULL
		2. active = false
		3. primary = false
	* for associated photos that are associated with a product:
		1. seriesId = NULL
	* all associated products
		1. seriesId = NULL
		2. active = false

item.name: get carousel image or record list

request.description:
**image mode**
1. request:
  * header: n/a
  * params: n/a
  * queries:
    1. per_page: integer (should always be 1)
    2. page: integer
  * body: n/a
2. response:
  * header:
    1. Content-Type: depends on the mimeType of the image
    2. Link: pagination link header string (exist when pagination is active)
  * body: image data
3. notes:
  * should always start with ?per_page=1&page=1, and use the 'link header' information to navigate to the next image
  * page is always automatically set to be within range of photo count (never be out of bounds and cause error)

**record mode**
1. request:
  * header: n/a
  * params: n/a
  * queries: n/a
  * body: n/a

request.description:
1. request:
	* headers:
		1. Content-Type: multipart/form-data
		2. x-access-token: jwt string
	* params: n/a
	* queries: n/a
	* body: {"image":"photo file"}
2. response:
	* headers: {"Content-Type":"application/json"}
	* body: data property contains and carousel record object without actual image data
3. notes:
	* allowed file types:
		1. .jpg
		2. .jpeg
		3. .png
		4. .gif
		5. .svg
		6. .bmp
	* upload size are limited to 5 mb
	* carousel are automatically placed at the end of the displaySequence
